citation.article-title: Phycicoccus cremeus sp. nov., isolated from forest soil, and emended description of the genus Phycicoccus
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Phycicoccus cremeus sp. nov.
Phycicoccus cremeus (cre′me.us. N.L. masc. adj. cremeus cream–white).
Strictly aerobic, Gram-positive, heterotrophic, oxidase-negative and catalase-positive.
Cells are non-motile rods (0.5–0.8×1.5–2.0 μm).
Colonies on R2A agar are circular, entire, smooth, creamy coloured and 0.3–0.8 mm in diameter after 2 days at 30 °C.
Growth occurs on diluted TSB agar (1/10 and 1/20 strength of TSB) and on R2A agar.
Growth occurs at 14–35 °C (optimum, 29 °C), at pH 4.1–10.0 (optimum, pH 7.0–8.0) and in the presence of 0–7.0 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 0–2.0 %).
Nitrate reduction is observed.
Gelatin, casein, aesculin and Tween 80 are hydrolysed, but starch, DNA and Tween 20 are not.
Urease and arginine dihydrolase activities are absent.
Indole is not produced.
Voges–Proskauer reaction and glucose fermentation are negative.
d-Glucose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, maltose, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, gluconate and l-malate are assimilated, but l-arabinose, caprate, adipate, citrate and phenylacetate are not assimilated.

Leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase and α-mannosidase activities are present.
Weak alkaline phosphatase and esterase lipase (C8) activities are present.
Esterase (C4), lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and α-fucosidase activities are absent.
The most abundant cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, C17 : 1ω8c, 10-methyl-C17 : 0 and C15 : 0.
The predominant isoprenoid quinone is MK-8(H4).
The cell wall peptidoglycan contains meso-2,6-diaminopimelic acid and the acyl type of the muramic acid is acetyl.
The major polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol and six unknown glycolipids.
The type strain is V2M29T (=CGMCC 1.6963T =NBRC 104261T), isolated from forest soil.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 72.0 mol% (Tm).
